title: Track which dev services work using kubedock
body:
### Description

There have been discussion about running dev services over kubedock, to support dockerless environments.
We should first check which dev services work with `kubedock` and which are not.

### Failing Dev Services
Here's a list of Dev Services that do not work
- jdbc-db2
- jdbc-mariadb
- jdbc-mssql
- jdbc-mysql
- jdbc-oracle
- jdbc-postgresql 
  - default image (permissions)
  - centos image: centos/postgresql-95-centos7 - centos/postgres-12-centos-7 (can't find config)
  - redhat image: registry.redhat.io/rhscl/postgresql-95-rhel7 (can't find config)

See more details & logs in the comments below

### Working Dev Services
Here's a list of Dev Services that do not work
- redis
- keycloak

### Core extensions with DevService support
- [ ] agroal
- [ ] amazon-lambda
- [ ] amazon-lambda-http
- [ ] amazon-lambda-rest
- [ ] elasticsearch-rest-client
- [ ] elasticsearch-rest-client-common
- [ ] hibernate-orm
- [ ] infinispan-client
- [ ] jdbc-db2
- [ ] jdbc-derby
- [ ] jdbc-mariadb
- [ ] jdbc-mssql
- [ ] jdbc-mysql
- [ ] jdbc-oracle
- [ ] jdbc-postgresql
- [ ] kafka-client
- [x] keycloak-authorization
- [ ] keycloak-admin-client
- [ ] keycloak-admin-client-reactive
- [ ] kubernetes-client
- [ ] mongodb-client
- [ ] neo4j
- [ ] oidc
- [ ] opentelemetry
- [ ] reactive-mssql-client
- [ ] reactive-mysql-client
- [ ] reactive-oracle-client
- [ ] reactive-pg-client
- [x] redis-client
- [ ] schema-registry
- [ ] smallrye-reactive-messaging-amqp
- [ ] smallrye-reactive-messaging-kafka
- [ ] smallrye-reactive-messaging-mqtt
- [ ] smallrye-reactive-messaging-rabbitmq
- [ ] vertx-http
